revised_title: Observing the Transit of Venus over the Sun in 1761
tldr: In 1761, James Short observed the transit of Venus over the Sun from Savile-House in London. Despite cloudy conditions, he managed to make several measurements of Venus's distance from the Sun's limb and diameter using reflecting telescopes and an achromatic micrometer. The observations were made in the presence of the Duke of York and other royal family members.
